intro: Pentanisia annua, commonly known as the annual pentanisia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Americas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are usually greenish-white, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Pentanisia annua is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
